column4: When I am installing lampp in ubuntu ,it gives the error /opt/lampp/lampp: 14: Syntax error: "(" unexpected
why not use the solution from the repos?
'sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install tasksel; sudo tasksel;' select the lamp option ;)
'sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install tasksel; sudo tasksel;' select the lamp option ;)
tasksel is the easiest method IMHO
how can I run the lamp now?
how do you mean "run" it? If you completed the installation it should be accessible at http://localhost
where can I store the php files? and how do I start and stop it?
by default /var/www is the root of the apache webserver(where you put the files) if you want to start/stop the webserver you use 'sudo service apache2 stop/start'
is this webserver ONLY going to be accessed locally by you?
ok the you may want to take ownership of the /var/www directory. 'sudo chown -R username:username /var/www'
you can install that from apt
'sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin' then access it at http://localhost/phpmyadmin
